data.title: Cool bar
data.text: This bar is pretty cool.  It is shaped as the outline of the corner of the street.  Great outdoor seating to watch the nightlife  go by.  Enloyed drinks at the bar and outside.   Not sure about food as we only had late evening drinks.

data.title: Smoking is allowed
data.text: Wife and I barely stepped inside before leaving. Way too smokey inside. Wife has asthma and can't breathe easily. Look somewhere else if you're in same boat.

data.title: Great service; great food!
data.text: We called an order in after a full day visiting local attractions.  It was easy to place the order and it was ready when we picked it up.  Great burger and salad and they made sure to include plenty of condiments and plastic ware. Nice little local bar/restaurant;  Warning: smoking is allowed in the establishment and even though I was only in there a few minutes picking up my order, I reeked of smoke.

data.title: Building is a must-see/experience!
data.text: This is one of my favorites in Chattanooga. Downtown location,spiral staircase to  rooftop seating, food was good, well-stocked bar, but my favorite thing is the building itself!  Unique, cute, old, wooden, nothing cookie-cutter about this place.       ( FYI - apparently it's against the law for ANYONE under 21 even to be one the premises.  We got kicked out with a 9 month old.)  Also, smoking is allowed which might be good news for some, but others might need the rooftop!

data.title: A+
data.text: Always a must stop when you are in Chattanooga.  Good food and good drinks.  The staff is always friendly.

data.title: Rooftop seating was nice.
data.text: Nothing spectacular about this restaurant.  Menu was average with a few interesting touches.  Good beer/drink selection. Staff seemed over worked, but they took care of us well.  Establishment is 21 and up, as they allow smoking inside.  I am not a smoker so I didn't care for this, but we sat outside on the rooftop and it was really nice. Good location.  We stopped for drinks in the afternoon.  Glad we did.

data.title: ANNIVERSARY TRIP
data.text: my husband an i went in for our first lunch of weekend. it looked really neat inside and the food was really good, however the server MICHAEL was the worse i've ever had !! he took our order after about a 10 min wait and there was only one other table down stairs and he was just walking around on his phone, after he took the order it took about 25 mins or so and it was wrong he ordered onion rings instead of chips and i order a pickle you know a pickle the only thing done is pulling it out of the barrell or jar and bring it to me. so we told him and he said the kitchen help is not good they are slow. so i said ok well we are waiting again maybe 10 mins or so later he brings theonion rings still no pickle i asked again and finally got the pickle i wanted the check as fast as we could get so we could get out of there and i had to get the lady behind the bar to even do that cause he never came back was awful ! but the was good so kitchen is actually doing there part.

data.title: Wonderful!!!!👍🏼👍🏼👍🏼😊
data.text: What a fun place!  We visited Chattanooga for the weekend and were walking down the street and came across this flat iron building which I thought was really quaint.  We decided to go in and check it out.  We shared a Reuben sandwich which was very yummy!  We had a beer and enjoyed the ambience that this quaint little place offered.  We highly recommend this place.  I even bought a t-shirt!  I'm now a walking billboard for them!! 👍🏼😊🍺

data.title: Soooooo cool!
data.text: Go here for beers every year we come down. People are so great. Go upstairs on the winding stairs to the roof! Great food too.

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text: I have eaten here several times and found this past trip no different from previous ventures.   This is a great little place for a light meal and a beer.   A great atmosphere and a good place to take a rest and enjoy a beer and some fried pickles.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: This place is incredible. Not a stupid chain. It is a bar that plays heavy metal music and serves cold beer and bar food. The fried pickles are pretty damn good. The shape of the building is interesting as well. All I can say if you want to drink a beer at a frown up bar then this is the place to be downtown Chattanooga.

data.title: Perpetual tourist
data.text:
We must look perpetually rested. No, I'm fairly sure that the reason for comment is the British accent that makes the "hostess" think we are just off the boat.  We were new 28 years ago.  Each of the last 5 or 6 visits I have said, in response to questioning from the same hostesses, that we actually live in Toronto, we are not tourists.  
The lighting is low, the turnover quick, the service is acceptable but obviously a result of standardized training rather than genuine warmth. The introductions "my name is Maria and I'll be your server tonight" and explanations are done at record pace.The menu is shorter than it once was (we have been here for 28 years)and there is a shift away from it being a Jewish-style diner. Ms. Reisman's healthy options are ones I usually avoid; those are are things like a simple stir fry, salmon dishes or low fat and low carb options.I can make those at home.  I like the carbs anywayou! That said, the fruity salad on the summer menu was good.The other salads are not as great as the ones they used to offer; quinoa, kale and so on might be fashionable but they get boring. The sandwiches lack the oomph of the originals, and are much smaller.  If that's what you want I advise a trip to Craplanskys instead. 
The desserts are creative in that the offering of mini options is neat; maybe that encourages folks to have a dessert when they might not otherwise.  The dessert choices are too heavily leaning toward  chocolate,  and lack the good caramel meringue cake  they used to do. I think greater waffle and pancake choices, and ice cream options would encourage the casual eaters to come here,as well as the after dinner crowd.I don't know what their breakfast consumers want. 
The menu is sufficiently broad that it can satisfy most people of all ages, but there are many missed opportunities.

data.title: Like stepping back in time!
data.text: Loved this little place.  We sat in the narrow window seat at the front of the place.  It's like taking a step back in time!  Left our mark by signing our names on the seat.  The fried pickles were great, service was great!  It's a must see in Chattanooga.

data.title: The shape of restaurant is interesting
data.text:
This isn't the cleanest restaurant but it is very old and unique.  As far as the tables they are kept very clean and the inside seems clean ..... It is just an old establishment with old windows that aren't kept clean but a fun atmosphere to eat in.
The food was excellent especially their Reuben sandwich. My husband had a hamburger that he enjoyed.  There is a large selection to chose from.

data.title: Flexible and good beer
data.text: The only bad thing about this place is it's not a smoke-free establishment... but it has a nice feel to it with very flexible waiting and cooking staff that took an order from me that was a mix of two different dishes.  The beer selection is not the biggest but it had good stuff.

data.title: Unique little place
data.text: Good reuben sandwich, back n blue burger, and fried pickles! Good service too. Only surprise was that smoking was permitted inside.  Thought second hand smoke was done a long time ago!

data.title: We visited this place because of the late night menu
data.text: We arrived to the city around 10pm and wanted to grab a few drinks and some food. After we settled into our place and headed out it was 12am. most bars stayed open late but the kitchens closed at midnight.  This was the only place in the downtown area still serving food, we were warned not to go there because its also one of the few bars where you can still smoke indoors.  We went anyway and after a 15 minute walk to get there we climbed a narrow stairway to a rooftop deck which was very nice, ordered a couple beers and burgers. The burgers were ok but the tater tots were great! I probably would not come back because I do not enjoy indoor smoking establishments but for late night eats it worked.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: We requested special order food, they brought the cook out and 15 min later- perfection!!   Atmosphere, food, beer servers were all excellent.   Best fried pickles ever!

data.title: Authentic
data.text: Small, authentic little bar with a great selection of beers/cocktails. Historical building in a great setting.

data.title: It's the food not the atmosphere
data.text: I read several reviews and had my expectations managed.   We had the rueben sandwich and it was really good.   The service, food, drinks and rooftop deck were a great choice for a laid back Sunday lunch.   The prices were very reasonable too!  Oh yea... the pickles were really good.
